NEW DELHI: Indian men’s ice hockey team ’s participation in the forthcoming Asian Winter Games — to be held in China’s Harbin from Feb 7-14 — is still uncertain.As TOI had reported earlier, the ice hockey team was not cleared by the sports ministry for the Games, which had elicited a strong response from PT Usha , the president of Indian Olympic Association (IOA).IOA had cleared the team for participation, sending the list of athletes to the organisers in November.Despite this, the ministry called for a fresh selection trial in Leh on Saturday to pick its choice of ice hockey athletes. The ministry had issued an office circular in this regard on Jan 24, calling in ice hockey players to assemble at Nawang Dorjay Stobdan Sports Complex in Leh for trials.A total of 34 names were listed for trials at the Leh ice hockey rink. However, reportedly, only eight athletes turned up for the trials.This prompted Usha to write to sports minister Mansukh Mandaviya. The federation governing the ice hockey affairs in the country – Ice Hockey Association of India (IHAI) – is recognised by both the sport’s global governing body and IOA.IHAI is also recognised by the ministry as a ‘National Sports Promotion Organisation’.There is another federation claiming to be the official body. Usha wrote in her letter: “The ministry received two lists of players, both of which are not recognised NSFs of ice hockey.Therefore, it has directed SAI to conduct trials. The ice hockey team recommended for participation in the 9th Asian Winter Games has been selected by IHAI which is an affiliated unit of IOA.The selection process was conducted in accordance with the guidelines. The names of the selected team members were entered in the registration system of Winter Games as per the deadline of Dec 7, 2024, and no fresh names can be added.”It remains to be seen what the ministry says to this.
Article Summary: Indian men’s ice hockey team ’s participation in the forthcoming Asian Winter Games is still uncertain. Indian Olympic Association had cleared the team for participation, sending the list of athletes to the organisers in November. Despite this, the ministry called for a fresh selection trial in Leh on Saturday to pick its choice of ice hockey athletes.

Article Title: TikTok ban averted? White House reportedly in talks for Oracle-led majority stake to reduce Chinese ownership
Article Text:
TikTok facing shutdown in US

The White House is currently in talks with software company Oracle and other US investors to take over the global operations of the popular video-sharing app TikTok, according to two sources with direct knowledge of the negotiations, quoted by US' National Public Radio (NPR).The proposed arrangement would allow ByteDance, TikTok's Chinese parent company, to maintain a minority position, whilst Oracle would supervise the app's algorithm, data collection and software updates. Oracle already provides TikTok's web infrastructure foundation.Under the terms being discussed, Oracle would monitor and provide oversight of TikTok's algorithm, data collection, and software updates, effectively giving American investors a majority stake in the company. The exact terms of the deal are still being negotiated and could change."The goal is for Oracle to effectively monitor and provide oversight with what is going on with TikTok," said a person directly involved in the talks, who was not authorized to speak publicly about the deliberations, quoted by NPR. "ByteDance wouldn't completely go away, but it would minimize Chinese ownership."Officials from Oracle and the White House held a meeting on Friday to discuss the potential deal, with another meeting scheduled for next week. Oracle is reportedly interested in acquiring a stake in TikTok "in the tens of billions," but the rest of the deal remains in flux.Microsoft is also reportedly amongst other potential investors involved in the discussions. Meanwhile, Perplexity AI also presented a merger proposal to ByteDance last week, offering to combine operations with TikTok's US division, according to CNBC's exclusive report.Trump previously endorsed a TikTok acquisition attempt by Oracle and Walmart in 2020 that ultimately failed. An NPR source close to the current talks indicated the retailer is not participating after concerns about the app's valuation.Appeasing Congress is seen as a key hurdle in the negotiations. Under a law passed by Congress and upheld by the Supreme Court, TikTok must execute a "qualified divestiture" from ByteDance to continue operating in the US President Trump has wide latitude to interpret what this means, but experts suggest it could involve ByteDance retaining a minority stake."A key part is showing there is no operational relationship with ByteDance, that they do not have control," said a Congressional staffer involved in talks about TikTok's future. "There needs to be no backdoors where China can potentially gain access."Eliminating potential ways for Chinese authorities to access TikTok's data and algorithm has been a long-standing concern among technology experts. Sarah Kreps, who focuses on technology and foreign policy at the Brookings Institution, noted the difficulty in proving the absence of Chinese control over data and the algorithm.The current negotiations follow the collapse of a previous national security plan involving Oracle, known as Project Texas, which failed to guarantee TikTok's independence from ByteDance. In April, Congress attached a divest-or-ban measure to a foreign aid bill, giving ByteDance until January 19 to shed its Chinese owner.Chinese regulators, who have previously opposed the selling of TikTok, recently signaled that they would not stand in the way of a TikTok ownership change, stating that acquisitions "should be independently decided by the enterprises and based on market principles." White House negotiators believe this indicates that Beijing is not planning to block a deal that gives American investors a majority stake in the company.Meanwhile, Apple and Google have not yet returned TikTok to their app stores after the platform went offline for about 14 hours. Without their support, the app cannot receive software updates or be downloaded on Apple devices or found in the Google Play app store. Trump's executive order was sufficient for Oracle and other web infrastructure companies to restore TikTok's services, but other companies, including Apple and Google, are not taking the risk due to the potential for hundreds of billions of dollars in fines under the TikTok ban law.TikTok which was shutdown for a few hours on January 18 but came back online around 12 hours later, with a message confirming support from Trump, who signed an executive order delaying the looming ban by 75-days on Day 1 of his presidency.
Article Summary: The White House is in talks with Oracle and other US investors to take over the global operations of the popular video-sharing app TikTok. The proposed arrangement would allow ByteDance, TikTok's Chinese parent company, to maintain a minority position. Oracle would supervise the app's algorithm, data collection and software updates.

Article Title: Musk: Elon Musk says Twitter in precarious position, defends cost cuts
Article Text:
"I will resign as CEO as soon as I find someone foolish enough to take the job!" Musk said.

SAN FRANCISCO: Elon Musk is defending his massive cost-cutting at Twitter as necessary for the social media platform to survive next year, due in part to debt payments tied to his $44 billion takeover of the company."This company is like, basically, you're in a plane that is headed towards the ground at high speed with the engines on fire and the controls don't work," Musk told a late-night audience on a Twitter Spaces call Tuesday.That's after Elon Musk said earlier on Tuesday that he plans on remaining as Twitter's CEO until he can find someone willing to replace him in the job.Musk's announcement came after millions of Twitter users asked him to step down in an online poll the billionaire himself created and promised to abide by."I will resign as CEO as soon as I find someone foolish enough to take the job!" Musk tweeted. "After that, I will just run the software & servers teams."Since taking over the San Francisco social media platform in late October, Musk's run as CEO has been marked by quickly issued rules and policies that have often been withdrawn or changed soon after being made public.Musk said Tuesday night that he "spent the last five weeks cutting costs like crazy" and trying to build a stronger paid subscription service because otherwise Twitter might be operating with $3 billion in negative cash flow next year. He in part blamed the $12.5 billion in debt tied to his April agreement to buy the company, as well as the Federal Reserve's recent interest rate hikes.Some of Musk's actions have unnerved Twitter advertisers and turned off users. He has laid off more than half of Twitter's workforce, released contract content moderators and disbanded a council of trust and safety advisors that the company formed in 2016 to address hate speech and other problems on the platform.The Tesla CEO has also alienated investors at his electric vehicle company over concerns that Twitter is taking too much of his attention, and possibly offending loyal customers.Even more unnerving for investors, Tesla shares are plummeting.Shares of Tesla are down 35% since Musk took over Twitter on Oct. 27, costing investors billions. Tesla's market value was over $1.1 trillion on April 1, the last trading day before Musk disclosed he was buying up Twitter shares. The company has since lost 58% of its value, at a time when rival auto makers are cutting in on Tesla's dominant share of electric vehicle sales.Shares fell Wednesday, as they have every day this week.A single share of Tesla that cost about $400 to start the year, can now be had for less than $140.Musk sought to defend some of his recent Twitter decisions on the Twitter Spaces call."They may seem sometimes spurious or odd or whatever," Musk said. "It's because we have an emergency fire drill on our hands. That's the reason. Not because I'm naturally capricious. Or at least, aspirationally, I'm not naturally capricious."Musk, who also helms the SpaceX rocket company, has previously acknowledged how difficult it will be to find someone to take over as Twitter CEO .Bantering with Twitter followers earlier this week, he said that the person replacing him "must like pain a lot" to run a company that he said has been "in the fast lane to bankruptcy.""No one wants the job who can actually keep Twitter alive. There is no successor," Musk tweeted.As things stand, Musk would still retain overwhelming influence over platform as its owner. He fired the company's board of directors soon after taking control.
Article Summary: Elon Musk says he plans on remaining as Twitter's CEO until he can find someone willing to replace him in the job. Musk's run as CEO has been marked by quickly issued rules and policies that have often been withdrawn or changed soon after being made public. Musk has laid off more than half of Twitter's workforce, released contract content moderators.
